title: contrib/lock: Doubtful about the example of distributed locks.
body:
### What happened?

1. There is an error in the description of the `contrib/lock/README.md`  file.
detail: https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/tree/main/contrib/lock
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21985684/178985875-3f51c0a9-b58d-404d-b3ee-71d14cc42701.png)
The `client2` can't acquire the lock, because the lock has been acquired by the `client1`. And this is the same result when testing locally.
2. Why do version verification in the `storage` server?
If doing this, from the second time on, running the `client.go` will definitely report an error. Because the values of `session.Lease()` are different.
https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/blob/73c714bf3d16e77d30175d8e27682190006e50fa/contrib/lock/storage/storage.go#L79-L92 

### What did you expect to happen?

Maybe I need more details about these code.

### How can we reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)?

Running the `contrib/lock/storage/storage.go` and `contrib/lock/storage/client.go` files.

### Anything else we need to know?

_No response_
